intro: Impatiens lukwangulensis, commonly known as the Lukwangulu impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its strikingly colorful, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, while its natural habitat supports a diverse array of pollinators.
